intro: Chesneya grubovii, commonly known as the Grubov's chesneya, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces showy yellow or orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
